availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Dunstall (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Native of Sussex, England. Married to Fanny Barns Dunstall. Father of Mary R. Dunstall, Martha Ann Dunstall, and William Dunstall. Farmer in Kenton County in 1850. Employed John Hands as a laborer in Pendleton County in 1850 Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from January 25, 1863 to May 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 145B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 674.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 78 and 476.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Pendleton County Wills, 1841-1967; Vol 2, 1872-1917 (Accessed through ancestry.com on October 11, 2019), p. 14.
